_comment: Analysis schema configuration - customize what information is extracted from papers

standard.name: Standard Analysis
standard.description: Balanced analysis for most papers - extracts core information with good detail

title.description: The title of the research paper

authors.description: A list of the authors of the paper

year.description: The publication year of the paper

doi.description: The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of the paper

journal.description: The journal or venue where the paper was published

abstract.description: The abstract of the content as it appears in the document

key_points.description: 10-15 key points extracted from the content. These should be bullet points that are easy to read and understand, but do not include the punctuation marks for the bullet points. These should be the most important points of the content.

summary.description: A summary of the content. This should be a multi-paragraph summary of the content that is easy to read and understand.

objectives.description: Primary objectives or research questions addressed

methodology.description: Detailed description of the methods and study design. Include the model design architecture if applicable.

results.description: Key quantitative or qualitative results. This should be a summary of the results of the study.

discussion.description: Interpretation of the results and their implications. What does this article contribute to the field?

strengths.description: Strengths and positive aspects of the study

weaknesses.description: Weaknesses, shortcomings, or areas of concern

tags.description: List of clear, simple, and consistent tags or keywords for the article

standard.instructions: Provide comprehensive analysis focusing on objectives, methodology, results, and critical evaluation. Extract 10-15 key points and a detailed multi-paragraph summary.

detailed.name: Detailed Analysis
detailed.description: Exhaustive analysis for important papers - captures every available detail

title.description: The title of the research paper

authors.description: A list of the authors of the paper

year.description: The publication year of the paper

doi.description: The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of the paper

journal.description: The journal or venue where the paper was published

abstract.description: The abstract of the content as it appears in the document

key_points.description: 10-15 key points extracted from the content

summary.description: A multi-paragraph summary of the content

objectives.description: Primary objectives or research questions addressed

methodology.description: Detailed description of the methods and study design. Include the model design architecture if applicable. This should be an extremely detailed description.

data.description: Datasets or data sources used, including size and key characteristics

experimental_setup.description: Experimental or analytical setup, including controls and variables. This should be a detailed description.

evaluation_metrics.description: Metrics used to evaluate performance or results

discussion.description: Interpretation of the results and their implications. What does this article contribute to the field? What advancements does it bring? How can this be applied in other domains?

strengths.description: Strengths and positive aspects of the study, including the model architecture, data, and methodology

weaknesses.description: Weaknesses, shortcomings, or areas of concern

limitations.description: Explicitly stated or inferred limitations, weaknesses, shortcomings, or areas of concern

future_work.description: Suggested future work or open questions

related_work.description: Key related works and how this paper differs

tags.description: List of clear, simple, and consistent tags or keywords

detailed.instructions: Extract every available detail from the paper. Provide exhaustive descriptions of methodology, experimental setup, data characteristics, evaluation metrics, and results. Include comprehensive critical analysis covering strengths, weaknesses, limitations, and future directions.

minimal.name: Minimal Analysis
minimal.description: Quick overview for rapid screening - extracts only essential information

title.description: The title of the research paper

authors.description: A list of the authors of the paper

year.description: The publication year of the paper

abstract.description: The abstract as it appears in the document

key_points.description: 3-5 most important key points from the paper

minimal.instructions: Provide a brief overview - focus on title, authors, abstract, and 3-5 key points. Keep it concise for rapid screening.

custom.name: Custom Schema
custom.description: User-defined analysis schema - modify fields and instructions as needed

title.description: The title of the research paper

custom_field_example.description: Add your own custom fields here - this is just an example. Delete this and add fields you want extracted.

custom.instructions: Add your custom extraction instructions here. Guide the LLM on what specific information to extract and how to format it.
